pros: Fantastic work culture with great perks and lovely open, busy office.
cons: Very few cons, sometimes communications/expectations between London & Stratford are a little lost but nothing a phone call couldn’t iron out.

pros: People If you love theatre the benefits are outstanding Creative and different
cons: all done at expensive of the non-artists. high expectations of workload based on an expectation that you work here for love. Even if you're in the corporate side. Pay is charity scale but the higher side Decisions take forever or are done at breakneck speed. there is no balance

pros: Nice people, good work, good opportunity,
cons: When Covid hit, not their fault

review_title: Not all it’s cracked up to be
pros: Some teams are awesome to work with, others much less so.
cons: Run by the OxBridge crowd, many of whom are (unsurprisingly) former bankers - including the the chair of the board and exec director. Suffers from a lack of respect that permeates down from the highest levels. Not a real charity, more a rich, white, person’s club.

job_title: Team Member in Stratford, London, England
pros: Some nice people to work with
cons: -slightly institutionalised and set in its ways

pros: Lots of plays and events
cons: Management sometimes do not listen

pros: Good pay, nice colleagues, nice environment
cons: Not too many cons to report.

pros:
Genuine & invested colleagues 
Great office & location 
Brilliant company perks 
Positive and open culture
cons: 5 word minimum = nothing.

job_title: Museum Collections Assistant in Stratford-upon-Avon, England
pros: Getting to work with an amazing collection of items. You can see that people are working hard to make changes to how the company is run and make a difference after major social changes since national lockdowns.
cons: The company is big, so changes do take time and communication from department to department takes a lot of effort to get right.

good pay
everyone is really nice

pros: A most excellent employer. Enjoyed my time there.
cons: The pay is not the best.

job_title: Front of House in Stratford-upon-Avon, England
pros: The company has an excellent reputation and tends to produce exciting work which is nice to be a part of. In comparison to other theatres, the pay is very good.
cons:
The company does not invest in staff. No time is put into training or developing those who wish to progress in their career and instead management roles are given to external candidates. 
Some middle management in audience care make work difficult and unpleasant for those on the ground.

pros: A free ticket and one £10 ticket to all shows, friendly workforce
cons: The tendency for quite a negative spirit, quite fed-up and bored by the routine - cafe itself needs serious spruce up

pros: Amazing staff, company culture, good pay, great perks - shows/free tickets etc all round an incredible place. Worked here for 5 years and fond memories forever.
cons: Uniform? but you get used to it!

pros: There are some really lovely and  supportive people in other sectors of the business.
cons: Toxic environment in the cafe.   Everyone who was really good left because of bullying and intimidation; too much gossip; managers appear not in control of the situation and did not listen.  Element of 'put up or shut up';  high turnover of staff. Concerns about health and safety and work life balance.

review_title: Good money, nice people, flexible, but inconsistent shift patterns
pros: Flexible, easy, friendly, varied, good money
cons: Late rotas, employee care could be better

pros: progressive culture, exciting events, inspiring environment
cons: too hierarchal, stifling and un-empowering management style

job_title: Customer Service in Warwick, West Midlands, England
pros: You'll meet some of the most amazing people
cons: Prefer not to say anything negative
